page.title: 07Cherhill C.E. Primary School
page.content:
The present Cherhill school opened on 3rd May 1961 when old schools closed at{Compton Bassett, Yatesbury, {Calstone}and{Cherhill.
This year (84-85) there are{98}pupils} in 4 classes with a Headmaster with 3 full-time and 1 part-time teacher. Meals for about 30 children are cooked each day by a cook and helpers. There are also 3 cleaners.
Recently the top class (9-11 years) have been drawing maps of Europe, learning about tessellations, sketching the village, visiting {Windsor Castle}for Â£4.25 each and working on the{Domesday Project.
When children leave here most of them go on to the{John Bentley {Comprehensive School}in Calne.
